turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: He's... dreamy.  He's...

turns.speaker: CHOIR
turns.text: Yes, Mary?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: HE'S SO FINE...

turns.speaker: CHOIR
turns.text: SING!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Were you tempted?

turns.speaker: CHOIR
turns.text: SING! SING AND YOUR SPIRIT WILL SOAR!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: But I'm fearful!

turns.speaker: CHOIR
turns.text: SING!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: And I'm tearful!

turns.speaker: CHOIR
turns.text: SING!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: YES I'LL SING AND KNOW JOY EVERMORE

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: So, hi there.  I'm... Sister Mary Clarence.  And you're... young Christians.  I guess I should assign you this passage.  What's good?  What were you talking about?

turns.speaker: LAWANDA
turns.text: We were talking about the wild thing. Teen promiscuity.

turns.speaker: LAWANDA
turns.text: How come?  Sister?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Well... because it's in the Bible. "Thou shalt not..."  Thou shalt not.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Excuse me -- just what are you all doing here?  At Sunday School?

turns.speaker: LAWANDA
turns.text: 'Cause we love it so damn much.  And cause we gotta come here.  Probation.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Probation?

turns.speaker: LAWANDA
turns.text: Well, what about the sex stuff?  What if some dude is after you, and he's always saying stuff, commin' on sweet and mellow.  Like, oh, baby, you know you'll love it.  Oh, baby, if you loved me, you'd stay.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: And you listen to that?

turns.speaker: LAWANDA
turns.text: No, but... I don't know... sometimes.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Hey, I know, it's hard.  But do what I do.

turns.speaker: LAWANDA
turns.text: What you do?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Just tell him, I do love you, but I can't -- I'm a nun.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: How are you doing.

turns.speaker: LAWANDA
turns.text: Hey, Sisters.  Are you going in there?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: You know it.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: What do you want?  This is a private area!  Get lost!

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: You ain't got nothin' I ain't seen.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Then stop trying to memorize it.  Hit the road.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: His ashes?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: With love.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Yeah, right to the cops.  No way.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Mary Robert, don't panic.  Remember what we talked about?  Experience?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: You can handle this.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Okay, Christy -- strip.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: That... thing.  That nun thing.  Take it off.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Come on -- stay.  Just a little.  We can talk, I'll get a pizza.  Pizza in bed, we'll have fun.  And you still haven't told me what happened.  What did she say?

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: What did who say?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Who?  The other woman.  Your wife.

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: You are so damn sexy.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Vince...

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: How did I get so lucky?  What is it now, five years we've been together?  Who do I thank?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Today was the deadline, Vince.

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: I want us to be together.  Like people. Honest, decent people.  In the eyes of God.  Babe, today... I went to confession.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: You did what?

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: For the first time in I don't know how long.  I wanted everything done right. Open and above board.  I told Father Antonelli I was in love.  I told him it was a special love, for all the ages.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: You said that?  And what did he say? Did he say you could leave her?  Did he say we'd be happy?

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: He said that if I got a divorce I'd burn in Hell.  For all eternity.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: You want me to go against a priest?  Get excommunicated?  You think I'm nuts?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: You bastard!

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: We can still see each other.  Just like always.  It's a different kind of sin. Smaller.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: You pig!

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: Babe, it's not me!  I love you!  It's God!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: You lying sleazeball!  The best years of my life!  What am I, garbage?  Am I lint?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: No... it's fine.

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Thanks.  A lot.

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: Is that why you came up here, Christy? To thank me?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: And to say you're sorry.  About this afternoon.  And the things you said. Forgotten.  Completely.  Do you understand?  Forgotten.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Right.  Yeah.  Forgotten.

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: Babe, what happened here?  Look at you.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Good evening, Vincent.

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: What, Vincent?  This is me, doll.  I know you.  What did you think you were doing?  Running to the cops.  Hiding out. No, no.  You're sorry now, aren't you?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: I am sorry for all my sins.  And yours.

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: She's afraid.  Come on, tell the boys you're afraid.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: I feel sorry for you, Vincent.  And I forgive you.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Right here.  Let the others go -- they have nothing to do with this.

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: Joey -- do it.

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: I was good to you! You re nothing but no-talent garbage! You're a two-bit Tramp!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: That used to be true, Vince.  I was with you.  But something happened.  And I'm different now.  Real--different.  I've had, well, you might call it -- a religious experience.  And I've got just two words for you.  And those two words are...

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Oh, girls.

turns.speaker: RONELLES
turns.text: Yes, Betty?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: This prom is a real drag.

turns.speaker: RONELLES
turns.text: Oh-huh.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Oh my!

turns.speaker: RONELLES
turns.text: What is it, Betty?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Look at that.  Get a gander.

turns.speaker: RONELLES
turns.text: Oh my!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: He's so dreamy.  He's like... a Greek god.  He's the cutest guy here.    He's boss.  He's fab.  He's...

turns.speaker: RONELLES
turns.text: Yes, Betty?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: HE'S SO FINE.

turns.speaker: RONELLES
turns.text: D00-LANG, DOO-LANG, D00-LANG.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: WISH HE WAS MINE.  THAT HANDSOME BOY OVER THERE, THE ONE WITH THE WAVY HAIR.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: Isn't it a glorious morning?  Good morning, Mary Clarence.  sleep well?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Where did that come from?

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: I haven't heard that song in ages.  The Ronettes?

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: 1961?  '62?  Mary Clarence, that's when many of us took final vows.  It's the last secular music we recall.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: No. HEY -- HE KNOWS THAT YOU BEEN CREATING NOW YOU'RE GONNA GET A BEATING

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: The minute I saw you. I said to myself, she's a weaver.  Have you ever used a loom?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Not in years.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: Well, it all comes back, in just a jiffy.  I'm working on a wall-hanging, of the convent.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: To sell, of course.  I hate to say it, but we're in terrible trouble here at St. Katherine's.  We need a new roof, the furnace is going, and there's no money.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: But don't you get money?  From the Vatican?

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: Mary Clarence.  Goose.  We're completely self-supporting.  Like all convents. Like yours.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Oh, right.  At my old place, we used to... wash cars.  Groom dogs.  So... nice loom.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: Isn't it lovely?  Now I'll demonstrate, and then you can hop right in.  You just draw your beater in, keep it pressed against the pick, and open the shed.  Then pass your shuttle, beat, and open the next shed.  Shuttle. beat, beat, shuttle, beat, shed.  Keep tension on the warp.  Is that clear?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Just about.  Show me again.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: You betcha.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: Shuttle, beat, shed.  And watch your heddles.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: I love my heddles.  Show me again.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Is this... choir practice?

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: Sure is!  Come on in, and sing a spell.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Hold on.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: Mary Clarence, could you?  Mary Lazarus, you're terrific, but...  Could you help us?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: You see?  We've got the voices.  They're just allover the place. I've heard all of you, in the shower --you're decent. Better than me.  We just need charts -- harmony -- chops.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: Chops?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: The goods.  The sound.  The sale.  Let's rearrange a few things.  Mary Patrick, you re not a natural soprano, you're an alto.  Get over here.  Mary Robert --with the sopranos.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: Two days.  An hour or so.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: No way.  We're a choir, right? Headliners.  The big room.  Two days a week won't cut it.  Every day.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: That machine.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: I know.  It's ancient.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: It's a rhythm section.  The beat.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Mary Patrick -- do you remember the Dixie Cups?

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: The Dixie Cups?  Oh my.  I was just a girl.  Of course.  SPRING IS HERE THE SUN WILL SHINE

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Hold it.  Mary Patrick, you're a pretty cheerful person, aren't you?

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: Am I?

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: All right, I am, I know it!  All my life, I've just been... upbeat. Optimistic.  Perky.  I can't help it. Even when I was little, I remember my mother used to say, "That child is pure sunshine.  She'll either be a nun -- or a stewardess."

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: So use it.  When we sing hymns, they're usually about rejoicing, right? Celebration.  Most music is.  So don't hold back.  Let all that joy go right into your voice.  Make me happy.  Let me hear it.  Perk out.  Perk down.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: SPRING IS HERE THE SUN WILL SHINE I'LL BE HIS AND HE'LL BE MINE WE'LL LOVE UNTIL THE END OF TIME AND WE'LL NEVER BE LONELY ANYMORE

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Because we're

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: We know you don't want to bring pain and misery to your friends and neighbors. We'll pray to find you some honest work.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: And we know that, even though most people would call you a leech and a parasite, the lowest slug of humanity! We know that deep down inside, you're probably even worse.  And so you truly need our prayers.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: What is it, Mary?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: That man -- who is he?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Jackpot!  Two buckets

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: This is so exhilarating!  All week long, I can't wait till Sunday, when we sing.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: Hurry, Sister!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Get moving.  I'm right behind you.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: MY SOUL WAS IN DANGER I'D FALLEN FROM GRACE

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: It's true -- I know her.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: DAMNATION WAS ALL I COULD SEE

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: What a shame!

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: BUT THEN CAME AN ANGEL WHO WHISPERED THESE WORDS

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Pay attention...

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: SING AND THE DEVIL WILL FLEE!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Were you wicked?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Which convent?  It was, um, the Little Sisters... of the Moonlight.  In Vegas. Everybody used to come to Mass.  Frank. Dean.  Sammy.  Right at ringside.

turns.speaker: MARY LAZARUS
turns.text: Enough jabber.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MARY LAZARUS
turns.text: Progressive convents.  Vanity.  It sounds awful.  It sounds just like this place.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Like this place?

turns.speaker: MARY LAZARUS
turns.text: I like my old convent, in Vancouver. Out in the woods.  It wasn't all modern, like here.  No electricity.  Cold water. Bare feet.  Those were nuns.  It was Hell on earth, but I loved it.  This place is a Hilton.

turns.speaker: MARY LAZARUS
turns.text: Shirelles.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: You know that song?

turns.speaker: MARY LAZARUS
turns.text: Soprano or alto?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Whatever.

turns.speaker: MARY LAZARUS
turns.text: Mary Clarence, are you with us?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Um, I don't really know this one...

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Sure.  Kind of... free-lance.

turns.speaker: MARY LAZARUS
turns.text: Free-lance?  Oh really?  You think I don't see?  You think I took vows yesterday?  I know what you're up to. You and Reverend Mother.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MARY LAZARUS
turns.text: You're a ringer.  She brought you in to replace me.  Out with the old.

turns.speaker: MARY LAZARUS
turns.text: Very nice.  Sisters, have we learned our lesson?  I won't hold this little episode against anyone.  I'll try not to.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Mary Robert.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Yeah, for one second.  That was the blend -- you've got to listen to each other.  Be a group.

turns.speaker: MARY LAZARUS
turns.text: I knew that.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Mary Lazarus, I get the feeling that you like discipline.  Hard work.

turns.speaker: MARY LAZARUS
turns.text: Of course.  I'm a nun.  Four Popes now. The Lord hates a loafer.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: I hear you.  How many days a week do you rehearse?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: I don't know.  Mary Lazarus, what do you think?  They're pretty raw.

turns.speaker: MARY LAZARUS
turns.text: Wet behind the ears.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: A bunch of real mama's girls.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: It'll be hell.

turns.speaker: MARY LAZARUS
turns.text: Tell me about it.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Don't look at your feet, and I don't want to see anybody counting.  Make it look easy.  Again!

turns.speaker: MARY LAZARUS
turns.text: Right, right, cross with the left, spin and turn!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Hopeless I

turns.speaker: MARY LAZARUS
turns.text: Amateurs 2

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Babies

turns.speaker: MARY LAZARUS
turns.text: Again!

turns.speaker: MARY LAZARUS
turns.text: She's a pro.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MARY LAZARUS
turns.text: Is there any syrup?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Well... see, at my old convent, I wasn't always... real popular.  I was sort of selfish and... not real helpful.  Okay, I'll say it -- I wasn't much of a nun. But now, thanks to all of you... maybe I'm shaping up.

turns.speaker: MARY LAZARUS
turns.text: We could cut a demo.  Look for a label.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: That's true, wouldn't that be great.  Of course, we never know when things are going to change.  Any one of us could be transferred to another convent, tomorrow.

turns.speaker: MARY LAZARUS
turns.text: Van Cartier.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: You know?  About me?  About everything?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Hey -- you re supposed to be the cheerful one.  Why do I suddenly feel like Snow White?

turns.speaker: MARY LAZARUS
turns.text: You re okay -- for a civilian.

turns.speaker: MARY LAZARUS
turns.text: JUST SING!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Sing!

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Come on, we're late.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: What?  What time is it?

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: It's after five.  We have to bathe.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Five a.m.?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: What?  What does she want now?  I did the dishes.  I oiled the pews.  I dusted the hymnals.  Two hundred hymnals.  Why can't people share?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: I... I brought you something.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: A cigarette?

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: An extra heel of bread.  Please take it, you need your strength.  You've been working so hard.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Thanks.  So which one are you? Sister Bruce?  Sister Doug?

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Mary Robert.  I'm... Mary Robert.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Right.  Okay.  Bob.  Nice to know you.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: So, Bob, how long have you been in? St. K's?

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Three years.  Sister.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Three years.  A rookie.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: A novice.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Yeah, like a learner's permit, right? When do you hit the big time?  You know, when do you take the final vows?

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: You have to help me

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Right, sure, but what's the problem? Are they keeping you a prisoner here? Do they drug you?  Did Reverend Mother like, kidnap your parents?  We can call the Enquirer.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: No, you don't understand -- I don't want to get out!  I want to get in?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Oh. Mary Clarence, I'm so unworthy.  I want to take my final vows, I would do it tomorrow, but Reverend Mother won't let me!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: She won't?  Why not?

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: She says I should wait.  She says that no one should become a nun as an escape from life.  She says that I'm not experienced enough to make the decision yet.  In a mature manner.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: She said that?  Reverend Mother?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Well, then there's only one thing to do.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Reverend Mother says you need experience, right, in life.  In order to make a responsible decision.  This is going to be very painful for me.  You know how much I love this little room. This whole convent.  Wait.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: We must do this sacred thing, Mary Robert.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Of course!  We must do it!  It's the will of God!  What is it?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: We must... get you some experience.  We must... leave this place.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Mary Clarence!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Now you.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: We need experience.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: It's part of St. Katherine's new community outreach program.  How old are you?  You shouldn't be smoking.  Have you ever seen a diseased lung?  Hand 'em over.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Bobs

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Experience!  Right?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: I have to do this.  So I can become a nun.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Initiation.  You understand.  Later on, we make her wear her underwear on her head.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Who are all these people?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: This is your neighborhood.  Your turf. You should get to know 'em.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: I'm getting experience.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: You watch yourself!

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Those people are wonderful!  Why don't we ever see them in church?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Good point.  Especially that dude you were with.  I'd like to see him down front.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Mary Clarence!  You're so... different from the other sisters.  Sometimes, well... sometimes you sound more like a layperson.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Honey.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: I can't wait to tell Reverend Mother about all my experiences.  I've learned so much.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Well, you know, you don't have to tell her everything.  I mean, nothing really happened.  We just... took a walk.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Mary Clarence!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Keep moving!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Goddamn it!

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Mary Clarence!

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Oh my Lord!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Experience!

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: What was all that?  Who was that man? Why would he shoot at us?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: I don't know, some people just don't like nuns.  I wish I had a ruler.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: We could have been killed!  But you saved me!  Thank you, Mary Clarence!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Mary Robert, I am so sorry about last night...

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Now stop that.  You didn't shoot at me. You were only trying to help, to give me experience.  I tried to explain that to Reverend Mother, but -- I don't know if she understood.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Mary Robert, I've watched you.  You never really sing.  You whisper. Nothing comes out.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: I don't want to mess anyone up...

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Give me a C.  A C!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: WE'RE THE SISTERS OF THE SACRED HEART WE DO OUR BIT, NOW DO YOUR PART

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: HONOR THY MOTHER AND THY FATHER TOO DON'T KILL, DON'T STEAL, IT'S BAD FOR YOU

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Yes, prayer is the answer, and prayers free  We're going to give free prayers to everyone who drives up to this house.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: We're nuns!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: It's contraband.  Don't ask.  But I wanted to give you a treat.  A sort of... thank-you gift.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: A thank-you?  For what?  You're the one we should be thanking.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Are you leaving us?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Oh no.  We'll always be together.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: The Council of Cardinals!  I'm so nervous!  What if I forget the words?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Right to Hell.  Just kidding. Where is that bus?

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Wait, this isn't the way.  Who are you?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: They're from my old convent.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Run!  Take off!

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Again?

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: But what do they want?  Where are we going?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: She's got nothing to do with this.  Let her go.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Mary Clarence!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Bless you.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: I WAS DOWNHEARTED

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: It's true!

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: I WAS HELL-BOUND, YES THAT'S WHAT THEY SAY SATAN WAS WAITING

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Don't you know it!

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: BUT THE LORD CAME TO ME

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: What did He say?

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: HE SAID, SING THE DEVIL AWAY!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: A convent?  They put me in a convent? What's the problem?  Wasn't there any more room in Hell?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: What is your full name?  Your Christian name?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Mother Theresa.  Gandhi.  Don't you understand?  This is all a mistake.  I'm the good guy.  I'm the witness.  And I'm being punished!

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Your name?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Christy.  Christy Van Cartier.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Enough joking.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: That's my real name!  Currently I'm a singer.  Sort of.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Very well.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Oh my God.  This isn't happening, tell me this isn't happening.  It's a nightmare, I'm back at St. Anne's!

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: St. Anne's?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Parochial school.  Akron.  St. Android's.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: You were unhappy?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: I was expelled!  When I was fifteen?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: The reason?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Beats me!  What do you think?  Smoking! Heavy petting, without a chaperone. Heavy petting, with the chaperone.  And wearing a black bra, under my uniform.  The demon bra.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: I see.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: You see?  You see?  I have to get out of here   I have to make a phone call. Don't you get  it?  I'm in a convent! You're a nun!

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Sit down.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Miss Van Cartier.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Your cigarette -- out.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: It has come to pass.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: I joined this convent some thirty years ago.  At that time, the world knew some measure of peace.  And hope.  Our order was a beacon of hospitality, to families, to children, to a neighborhood filled with promise.  And, as the years have passed, I have watched that promise destroyed.  Drugs.  Gangs.  Spandex.  And. so I have made this convent an oasis, a retreat from horror. And now that horror has invaded these sacred walls.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Are you talking about me?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: And all those like you.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: You mean black people?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Absolutely not.  I mean the wicked.  The heedless.  And their Las Vegas concubines.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: What's a concubine?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Check your driver's license.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Fine.  Got it.  Look, the way I see it, I'm stuck here, right?  I mean, I'm here or I'm target practice.  So here's the deal -- I don't bug you, you don't bug me.  I'll catch up on some sleep, watch some tube, lay back and lay low.  So just get me a key and show me to my room, and do not disturb.  Capisce?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Of course.  But it's almost lunch.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Cool.  Is there a menu?  Or buffet?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Before we do, you might like to freshen up.  And you'll certainly want to change

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Deal.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: How about a robe?  One of those big terry cloth jobs, with like embroidery on the pocket.  "Guest of St. Katherine's"

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Would you like that?
